what: Straightforward BibTeX and BibLaTeX Bibliography Management
title: Straightforward BibTeX and BibLaTeX Bibliography Management
text: RefManageR provides tools importing working bibliographic references. greatly enhances bibentry class providing class BibEntry stores BibTeX BibLaTeX references, supports UTF-8 encoding, can easily searched field, date ranges, various formats name lists (author last names, translator full names, etc.). Entries can updated, combined, sorted, printed number styles, exported. BibTeX BibLaTeX .bib files can read R converted BibEntry objects. Interfaces NCBI Entrez, CrossRef, Zotero provided importing references references can created locally stored PDF files using Poppler. Includes functions citing generating bibliography hyperlinks documents prepared RMarkdown RHTML. Please see vignette introduction NEWS latest changes. install latest version GitHub:
code: install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("ropensci/RefManageR")

title: Summary
text: RefManageR provides tools importing working bibliographic references. greatly enhances bibentry class R providing class BibEntry stores BibTeX BibLaTeX references, supports UTF-8 encoding, can easily searched field, date ranges, various formats name lists (author last names, translator full names, etc.) using R’s person class [@hornik2012]. Entries can updated, combined, sorted, printed number styles, exported. BibTeX [@bibtex] BibLaTeX [@biblatex] .bib files can read R converted BibEntry objects. Interfaces NCBI’s Entrez, CrossRef, Zotero provided importing references references can created locally stored PDFs using Poppler. Includes functions citing generating bibliography hyperlinks documents prepared RMarkdown RHTML. vignette available demonstrate functionality [@refmanager]. BibEntry objects can created directly R .bib file can read R create object. Tools provided importing references Crossref, Zotero, Google Scholar, PDFs looking PubMed ID’s DOIs. BibEntry objects may searched indexed field values, name lists, keys, dates, date ranges, etc. can printed number formats (e.g. text, html) base bibliography styles available BibLaTeX (e.g. alphabetic, numeric, authortitle, authoryear). sorting methods bibliographies available BibLaTeX LaTeX package implemented. function provided convert BibEntry object character vector containing lines BibTeX BibLaTeX file, converting fields, entry types expanding crossreferences coerce BibLaTeX entries BibTeX requested. results can also written file. Citations can gerenated number styles using one available functions citations. list references can printed based works user cited thus far document. citations bibliography can printed including hyperlinks using either R Markdown R HTML formats. function provided open electronic copies references PDF viewer web browser. simple function provided setting default formatting options throughout session.

title: Enhanced Bibliographic Entries — BibEntry
text: bibentry creates "bibentry" objects, modeled BibLaTeX BibTeX entries. entry   valid BibLaTeX BibTeX entry type.  list valid BibTeX entry types, see bibentry.  BibLaTeX supports entry types BibTeX backwards compatibility. BibLaTeX defines following entry types   ' article - article journal, magazine, newspaper, periodical forms   self-contained unit title.  Required fields: author, title, journal/journaltitle, year/date. book - single-volume book one authors authors share credit   work whole.  Required fields: author, title, year/date. (Also covers BibTeX @inbook). mvbook - multi-volume book. backwards compatibility, multi-volume books also   supported entry type @book.  Required fields: author, title, year/date. inbook - part book forms self-contained unit title. Note   profile entry type different standard BibTeX.  Required fields: author, title,   booktitle, year/date bookinbook type similar inbook intended works originally published   stand-alone book. suppbook - Supplemental material book. type closely related inbook entry   type. booklet - book-like work without formal publisher sponsoring institution.  Required fields:    author/editor, title, year/date. collection - single-volume collection multiple, self-contained contributions distinct    authors title.  Required fields: editor, title, year/date. mvcollection - multi-volume collection.  Also supported collection.    Required fields: editor, title, year/date. incollection - contribution collection forms self-contained unit distinct    author title.  Required fields: author, editor, title, booktitle, year/date. suppcollection - Supplemental material collection. manual - Technical documentation, necessarily printed form. Required fields:      author/editor, title, year/date misc - fallback type entries fit category.  Required fields:    author/editor, title, year/date online - online resource.  Required fields: author, title, number, year/date. patent - patent patent request.  Required fields: author, title, number, year/date. periodical - complete issue periodical, special issue journal.  Required    fields: editor, title, year/date suppperiodical - Supplemental material periodical. proceedings - single-volume conference proceedings.  Required fields: editor, title, year/date. mvproceedings - multi-volume @proceedings entry. Required fields: editor, title, year/date. inproceedings - article conference proceedings.  Required fields: author, editor, title,    booktitle, year/date. reference - single-volume work reference encyclopedia dictionary.  Alias          collection standard styles. mvreference - multi-volume reference entry. inreference - article work reference.  Alias incollection styles. report - technical report, research report, white paper published university    institution.  Required fields: author, title, type, institution, year/date. set - entry set. entry type special, see BibLaTeX manual. thesis - thesis written educational institution satisfy requirements degree.    Use type field specify type thesis.  Required fields: author, title, type, institution,    year/date. unpublished work author title formally published,    manuscript script talk.  Required fields: author, title, year/date. xdata - entry type special. xdata entries hold data may inherited    entries. (Biber .) custom[-f] Custom types (five) special bibliography styles. used standard     styles.

title: Set options/hooks for RefManageR — BibOptions
text: following valid package options. Options searching/indexing BibEntry object.  See [.BibEntry  [<-.BibEntry match.author - string; controls name list fields (author, editor, translator, etc.) matched  searching names. “family..initials” require family names given name initials match, “exact” requires names match exactly, value results family names compared (default). match.date - string; controls date fields matched searching.  “year.” (default), years checked equality comparing dates, otherwise months days also compared, available. use.regex - logical; TRUE, regular expressions used searching non-date fields; otherwise, exact matching used. ignore.case - logical; TRUE, case ignored searching. return.ind - logical; TRUE return value SearchBib operators  [.BibEntry, indices matches; otherwise, BibEntry object returned. Options Printing print.BibEntry PrintBibliography bib.style - string; Biblatex bibliography style use printing formatting BibEntry object.  Possible values “numeric” (default), “authoryear”, “authortitle”, “alphabetic”, “draft”. first.inits - logical; TRUE, given name initials displayed printing; otherwise, full names used. dashed - logical; TRUE bib.style = "authoryear" bib.style = "authortitle", recurring author editor names replaced “---” printing. sorting - string; controls BibEntry objects sorted.  Possible values “nty”, “nyt”,  “nyvt”, “anyt”, “anyvt”, “ynt”, “ydnt”, “none”, “debug”;  see  sort.BibEntry max.names - numeric; maximum number names display using “et al.” formatting printing name list fields. also minimum number names displayed “et al.” used (corresponding ‘minnames’ package option Biblatex). See option longnamesfirst using argument citation functions (Citet, etc.). .print.fields character vector; fields printed,  e.g., doi, url, isbn, etc. style - character string naming printing style.  Possible values  plain text (style “text”), BibTeX (“Bibtex”), BibLaTeX (“Biblatex”), mixture plain text BibTeX  traditionally used citations (“citation”), HTML (“html”),  LaTeX (“latex”), “markdown”, “yaml”,  R code (“R”), simple copy textVersion elements  (style “textVersion”, see BibEntry) Options Cite functions cite.style - character string; bibliography style use generate citations. style - , used format citations. hyperlink - character string logical; use style = "markdown" style = "html" (ignored otherwise).  FALSE, hyperlink generated citation bibliography printing.  set equal ".bib", hyperlinks generated linking citation bibliography.  default value, ".doc", try create hyperlink using url, doi, eprint fields  entry.  fields available, hyperlink point bibliography.  See also open.BibEntry. super - logical; superscripts used numeric citations?  Ignored  cite.style != "numeric". max.names - numeric; , except citations. Note, first time reference cited, option ignored longfirstnames TRUE. longnamesfirst logical; first time citation appears text truncated max.names? bibpunct - character vector; punctuation use citation.  entries bibpunct follows left delimiter non-alphabetic non-numeric citation styles right delimiter non-alphabetic non-numeric citation styles left delimiter alphabetic numeric citation styles right delimiter alphabetic numeric citation styles separator references citation. Punctuation go author year. check.entries - string FALSE; FALSE entries checked ensure  required fields type entry; “warn” entries checked, warning issued  entry processed anyway; otherwise error produced entry required fields (default).  Note majority fields listed required particular entry type Biblatex manual actually required Biblatex produce entry. merge.fields..check - character vector; merge.BibEntry operator +.BibEntry, fields checked comparing entries equality merging BibEntry objects.  Specifying  “” results fields checked duplicated.  default “key” check duplicated keys.

title: Cite a BibEntry object in text and print all citations — Cite
code: if (requireNamespace("bibtex")) {     file <- system.file("Bib", "biblatexExamples.bib", package = "RefManageR")     BibOptions(check.entries = FALSE)     bib <- ReadBib(file)     Citet(bib, 12)     NoCite(bib, title = "Alkanethiolate")     PrintBibliography(bib, .opts = list(style = "latex",                       bib.style = "authoryear")) } #> Herrmann, W. A., K. Öfele, S. K. Schneider, et al. #> (2006). #> ``A carbocyclic carbene as an efficient catalyst ligand for C--C #> coupling reactions''. #> In: \emph{Angew.\textasciitilde{}Chem. Int.\textasciitilde{}Ed.} 45.23, pp. 3859-3862. #>  #> Hostetler, M. J., J. E. Wingate, C. Zhong, et al. #> (1998). #> ``Alkanethiolate gold cluster molecules with core diameters from #> 1.5 to 5.2\textasciitilde{}nm''. #> In: \emph{Langmuir} 14.1, pp. 17-30. if (FALSE) {   if (requireNamespace("bibtex")){     Citep(bib, c("loh", "geer"), .opts = list(cite.style = "numeric"),           before = "see e.g., ")     Citet(bib, "loh", .opts = list(cite.style = "numeric", super = TRUE))     AutoCite(bib, eprinttype = "arxiv", .opts = list(cite.style = "authoryear"))     AutoCite(bib, eprinttype = "arxiv", .opts = list(cite.style = "pandoc"))     Citep(bib, author = "kant")     ## shorthand field in both entries gets used for numeric and alphabetic labels     TextCite(bib, author = "kant", .opts = list(cite.style = "alphabetic"))     TextCite(bib, author = "kant", .opts = list(cite.style = "numeric"))     TextCite(bib, author = "kant", .opts = list(cite.style = "alphabetic",              style = "html"))     punct <- unlist(BibOptions("bibpunct"))     punct[3:4] <- c("(", ")")     TextCite(bib, 33, .opts = list(bibpunct = punct, cite.style = "alphabetic"))      BibOptions(restore.defaults = TRUE)   } } if (FALSE) { library(knitr) ## See also TestNumeric.Rmd and TestAlphabetic.Rmd for more examples old.dir <- setwd(tdir <- tempdir()) doc <- system.file("Rmd", "TestRmd.Rmd", package = "RefManageR") file.show(doc) tmpfile <- tempfile(fileext = ".html", tmpdir = tdir) knit2html(doc, tmpfile) browseURL(tmpfile)  doc <- system.file("Rhtml", "TestAuthorYear.Rhtml", package = "RefManageR") file.show(doc) tmpfile <- tempfile(fileext = ".html", tmpdir = tdir) knit2html(doc, tmpfile) browseURL(tmpfile) setwd(old.dir) unlink(tdir) }

code: if (FALSE) { ## first two entries in library with bayesian in title ReadZotero(user = "1648676", .params = list(q = "bayesian",   key = "7lhgvcwVq60CDi7E68FyE3br", limit=2))  ## Search specific collection ## collection key can be found by reading uri when collection is selected in Zotero ReadZotero(user = "1648676", .params=list(q = "yu", key = "7lhgvcwVq60CDi7E68FyE3br",   collection = "3STEQRNU"))  ## Search by tag ## Notice the issue with how Zotero uses a TechReport entry for arXiv manuscripts ## This is one instance where the added fields of BibLaTeX are useful ReadZotero(user = "1648676", .params=list(key = "7lhgvcwVq60CDi7E68FyE3br",   tag = "Statistics - Machine Learning"))  ## To read these in you must set check.entries to FALSE or "warn" old.opts <- BibOptions(check.entries = FALSE) length(ReadZotero(user = "1648676", .params = list(key = "7lhgvcwVq60CDi7E68FyE3br",   tag = "Statistics - Machine Learning")))  ## Example using groups ReadZotero(group = "13495", .params = list(q = "Schmidhuber",   collection = "QU23T27Q")) BibOptions(old.opts) }

title: Import and Manage BibTeX and BibLaTeX references with RefManageR — RefManageR-package
text: RefManageR provides tools importing working bibliographic references.  greatly enhances bibentry class providing class BibEntry stores BibTeX BibLaTeX references, supports UTF-8 encoding, can easily searched field, date ranges, various formats name lists (author last names, translator full names, etc.). Entries can updated, combined, sorted, printed number styles, exported. BibTeX BibLaTeX .bib files can read R converted BibEntry objects.  Interfaces NCBI's Entrez, CrossRef, Zotero provided importing references references can created locally stored PDFs using Poppler.  Includes functions citing generating bibliography hyperlinks documents prepared RMarkdown RHTML.

title: Import and Manage BibTeX and BibLaTeX references with RefManageR — RefManageR-package
text: Importing Creating References BibEntry objects can created directly using BibEntry function.  .bib files can read R using ReadBib function. Tools provided importing references Crossref, Zotero, Google Scholar, PDFs looking PubMed ID's DOIs.  See ReadPDFs, ReadZotero, ReadCrossRef, ReadGS, ReadPubMed, GetPubMedByID, GetPubMedRelated. Manipulating BibEntry objects BibEntry objects may searched indexed field values, name lists, keys, dates, date ranges, etc. See [.BibEntry, [<-.BibEntry, [[.BibEntry, $.BibEntry. Printing Exporting Bibliographies print.BibEntry function can print number formats (e.g. text, html) base bibliography styles available BibLaTeX (e.g. alphabetic, numeric, authortitle, authoryear). toBibtex.BibEntry convert BibEntry object character vector containing lines BibTeX file, converting fields, entry types expanding crossreferences needed coerce BibLaTeX entries BibTeX.  toBiblatex converts BibEntry object character vector containing lines corresponding BibLaTeX file.  results can written file using WriteBib. Citations can generated number styles using one available functions citations.  list references can printed based works user cited thus far document.  See Cite.  citations bibliography can printed including hyperlinks using either R Markdown R HTML formats. Additional features sorting methods bibliographies available BibLaTeX LaTeX package implemented see sort.BibEntry references. Using open.BibEntry electronic copies references can opened PDF viewer web browser. convenience function BibOptions provided setting defaults commonly used functions print.BibEntry, [.BibEntry, Cite.  interface similar options.

code: file.name <- system.file("Bib", "biblatexExamples.bib", package="RefManageR") bib <- suppressMessages(ReadBib(file.name))  ## author search, default is to use family names only for matching bib[author = "aristotle"] #> [1] Aristotle. _De Anima_. Ed. by R. D. Hicks. Cambridge: Cambridge #> University Press, 1907. #>  #> [2] Aristotle. _Physics_. Trans.  by P. H. Wicksteed and F. M. #> Cornford. New York: G. P. Putnam, 1929. #>  #> [3] Aristotle. _Poetics_. Ed. by D. W. Lucas. Clarendon Aristotle. #> Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1968. #>  #> [4] Aristotle. _The Rhetoric of Aristotle with a commentary by the late #> Edward Meredith Cope_. Ed. by E. M. Cope. With a comment. by E. M. #> Cope. Vol. 3. 3 vols. Cambridge University Press, 1877.  ## Aristotle references before 1925 bib[author="aristotle", date = "/1925"] #> [1] Aristotle. _De Anima_. Ed. by R. D. Hicks. Cambridge: Cambridge #> University Press, 1907. #>  #> [2] Aristotle. _The Rhetoric of Aristotle with a commentary by the late #> Edward Meredith Cope_. Ed. by E. M. Cope. With a comment. by E. M. #> Cope. Vol. 3. 3 vols. Cambridge University Press, 1877.  ## Aristotle references before 1925 *OR* references with editor Westfahl bib[list(author="aristotle", date = "/1925"),list(editor = "westfahl")] #> [1] Aristotle. _De Anima_. Ed. by R. D. Hicks. Cambridge: Cambridge #> University Press, 1907. #>  #> [2] Aristotle. _The Rhetoric of Aristotle with a commentary by the late #> Edward Meredith Cope_. Ed. by E. M. Cope. With a comment. by E. M. #> Cope. Vol. 3. 3 vols. Cambridge University Press, 1877. #>  #> [3] G. Westfahl, ed. _Space and Beyond. The Frontier Theme in Science #> Fiction_. Westport, Conn. and London: Greenwood, 2000. #>  #> [4] G. Westfahl. “The True Frontier. Confronting and Avoiding the #> Realities of Space in American Science Fiction Films”. In: _Space and #> Beyond. The Frontier Theme in Science Fiction_. Ed. by G. Westfahl. #> Westport, Conn. and London: Greenwood, 2000, pp. 55-65.  ## Change some searching and printing options and search for author old.opts <- BibOptions(bib.style = "authoryear", match.author = "exact",                        max.names = 99, first.inits = FALSE) bib[author="Mart\u00edn, Jacinto and S\u00e1nchez, Alberto"] #> Almendro, José L., Jacinto Martín, Alberto Sánchez, and Fernando Nozal #> (1998). “Elektromagnetisches Signalhorn”. EU-29702195U (countryfr and #> countryuk and countryde). BibOptions(old.opts)  ## reset options  if (FALSE) {   ## Some works of Raymond J. Carroll's   file.name <- system.file("Bib", "RJC.bib", package="RefManageR")   bib <- ReadBib(file.name)   length(bib)    ## index by key   bib[c("chen2013using", "carroll1978distributions")]    ## Papers with someone with family name Wang   length(SearchBib(bib, author='Wang', .opts = list(match.author = "family")))    ## Papers with Wang, N.   length(SearchBib(bib, author='Wang, N.', .opts = list(match.author = "family.with.initials")))    ## tech reports with Ruppert   length(bib[author='ruppert',bibtype="report"])    ##Carroll and Ruppert tech reports at UNC   length(bib[author='ruppert',bibtype="report",institution="north carolina"])    ## Carroll and Ruppert papers since leaving UNC   length(SearchBib(bib, author='ruppert', date="1987-07/",                    .opts = list(match.date = "exact")))    ## Carroll and Ruppert papers NOT in the 1990's  length(SearchBib(bib, author='ruppert', date = "!1990/1999"))  identical(SearchBib(bib, author='ruppert', date = "!1990/1999"),           SearchBib(bib, author='ruppert', year = "!1990/1999"))  table(unlist(SearchBib(bib, author='ruppert', date="!1990/1999")$year))   ## Carroll + Ruppert + Simpson  length(bib[author="Carroll, R. J. and Simpson, D. G. and Ruppert, D."])   ## Carroll + Ruppert OR Carroll + Simpson  length(bib[author=c("Carroll, R. J. and Ruppert, D.", "Carroll, R. J. and Simpson, D. G.")])   ## Carroll + Ruppert tech reports at UNC "OR" Carroll and Ruppert JASA papers  length(bib[list(author='ruppert',bibtype="report",institution="north carolina"),             list(author="ruppert",journal="journal of the american statistical association")]) }

title: Merge two BibEntry objects while discarding duplicates — +.BibEntry
code: if (requireNamespace("bibtex")) {     file.name <- system.file("Bib", "biblatexExamples.bib", package="RefManageR")     bib <- suppressMessages(ReadBib(file.name))     bib1 <- bib[seq_len(44)]     bib2 <- bib[45:length(bib)]      ## The following is FALSE because the parent entry of one entry in bib1     ##   is in bib2, so the child entry is expanded in the BibEntry object     ##   returned by `[` to include the fields inherited from the dropped parent     identical(merge(bib1, bib2, 'all'), bib)     toBiblatex(bib1[[1L]])     toBiblatex(bib[[1L]])      ## Alternatively, the operator `[[` for BibEntry objects does not expand     ##   cross references     bib1 <- bib[[seq_len(44)]]     bib2 <- bib[[45:length(bib)]]     identical(merge(bib1, bib2, 'all'), bib)      ## Not strict enough     invisible(merge(bib1, bib2, c('title', 'date')))  } #> Duplicate entries found in second BibEntry object in position(s): 1  ## New publications of R.J. Carroll from Google Scholar and Crossref if (FALSE) { if (requireNamespace("bibtex")) {     bib1 <- ReadGS(scholar.id = "CJOHNoQAAAAJ", limit = '10', sort.by.date = TRUE)     bib2 <- ReadCrossRef(query = "rj carroll", limit = 10, sort = "relevance",       min.relevance = 80)     oldopt <- BibOptions(merge.fields.to.check = "title")     rjc.new.pubs <- bib1 + bib2     BibOptions(oldopt) } }

Possible values plain text (style “text”), BibTeX (“Bibtex”), BibLaTeX (“Biblatex”), mixture plain text BibTeX traditionally used citations (“citation”), HTML (“html”), LaTeX (“latex”), “markdown”, “yaml”, R code (“R”), simple copy textVersion elements (style “textVersion”, see BibEntry) bib.style - character string specifying BibLaTeX style use formatting references. See sort.BibEntry. max.names - maximum number names display name list fields truncation “et al.”. first.inits - logical; true initials given names printed, otherwise full names used. dashed - logical; .bibstyle = "authoryear" .bibstyle = "authoryear" , TRUE duplicate author editor lists replaced “---” printed. .print.fields character vector; fields printed, e.g., doi, url, isbn, etc. ... extra parameters pass renderer.

code: bib.text <- "@Manual{mclean2014,   author = {Mathew William McLean},   title = {Straightforward Bibliography Management in R Using the RefManager Package},   note = {arXiv: 1403.2036 [cs.DL]},   year = {2014},   url = {https://arxiv.org/abs/1403.2036}, }" tfile <- tempfile(fileext = ".bib") writeLines(bib.text, tfile) bib <- ReadBib(tfile) bib[1] <- list(c(date = "2014-03", key = "mwm2014")) #> Error in eval(kal): object '*tmp*' not found bib #> [1] M. W. McLean. _Straightforward Bibliography Management in R Using #> the RefManager Package_. arXiv: 1403.2036 [cs.DL]. 2014. #> <https://arxiv.org/abs/1403.2036>. unlink(tfile)  if (FALSE) {     file.name <- system.file("Bib", "RJC.bib", package="RefManageR")     bib <- ReadBib(file.name)     print(bib[seq_len(3L)], .opts = list(sorting = "none", bib.style = "alphabetic"))     ## add month to Serban et al., add URL and urldate to Jennings et al., and     ##   add DOI and correct journal to Garcia et al.     bib[seq_len(3L)] <- list(c(date="2013-12"),                             c(url="https://bsb.eurasipjournals.com/content/2013/1/13",                               urldate = "2014-02-02"),                             c(doi="10.1093/bioinformatics/btt608",                               journal = "Bioinformatics"))     print(bib[seq_len(3L)], .opts = list(sorting = "none", bib.style = "alphabetic"))     bib2 <- bib[seq_len(3L)]     bib2[2:3] <- bib[5:6]     bib2     bib2[3] <- c(journal='', eprinttype = "arxiv", eprint = "1308.5427",       eprintclass = "math.ST", pubstate = "submitted", bibtype = "misc")     bib2 }
